Adversary.Name: Corporate Representative
Adversary.Description: Please see page 429 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.

Talent.Name: Know Somebody
Talent.Description: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, reduce its rarity by 1 per rank of Know Somebody.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Adversary.Name: Physician
Adversary.Description: Please see page 430 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.

Talent.Name: Bacta Specialist
Talent.Description: Patients recover 1 additional wound per rank of Bacta Specialist when they recover wounds from bacta tanks or long term care.

Talent.Name: Surgeon
Talent.Description: When making a Medicine check to help a character heal wounds, the target heals 1 additional wound per rank of Surgeon.

Adversary.Name: Politician/Senator
Adversary.Description: Please see page 430 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.

Talent.Name: Commanding Presence
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Commanding Presence from Leadership and Cool checks.

Adversary.Description: Please see page 427 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Barrage
Talent.Description: Add 1 damage per rank of Barrage to 1 hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery skills at long or extreme range.

Talent.Name: Point Blank
Talent.Description: Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of one hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at short range or engaged.

Ability.Name: Droid
Ability.Description: Does not need sleep, to breath, eat, or drink. Can survive in a vacuum or under water. Immune to poisons and toxins.

Quality.Name: Autofire
Quality.Description: Active: Increase the difficulty of the attack by [DIFFICULTY]. If the attack hits the attacker can trigger Auto-fire. Auto-fire can be triggered multiple times.Each time the attacker triggers Auto-fire it deals an additional hit to the target.

Quality.Name: Cumbersome
Quality.Description: Passive: The character needs a Brawn characteristic equal to or greater than the weapon's Cumbersome rating.

Quality.Name: Pierce
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignores one point of Soak for each rank of Pierce

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Quality.Name: Breach
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignore one point of Armor for every rank of Breach

Quality.Name: Blast
Quality.Description: Active: If the attack is successful and Blast activates, each character (friend or foe) Engaged with the original target sufferes wounds equal to the weapon's Blast rating.

Quality.Name: Cumbersome
Quality.Description: Passive: The character needs a Brawn characteristic equal to or greater than the weapon's Cumbersome rating.

Quality.Name: Guided
Quality.Description: Active: Weapon can make an attack check at the end of the round, the check's Ability dice are equal to the weapon's Guided rating.

Quality.Name: Limitedammo
Quality.Description: Passive: May be used to make a number of attacks equal to it's Limited Ammo rating before it must be reloaded.

Quality.Name: Prepare
Quality.Description: Passive: The user must perform a number of Prepare maneuvers equal to the weapon's Prepare rating before making attacks.

Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Ability.Name: Silhouette 2
Ability.Description: Dewback has a silhouette of 2.

Ability.Name: Domesticated
Ability.Description: May be used as beasts of burden or ridden as mounts using the Survival skill. Dewbacks add [SETBACK] to all checks made to ride them.

Adversary.Name: Dianoga
Adversary.Description: Please see page 432 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Ability.Name: Amphibious
Ability.Description: Dianogas may breath underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Ability.Name: Crushing Grip
Ability.Description: A Dianoga has many tentacles and can maintain a grip on an unfortunate foe with some tentacles, while attacking with others. As long as it has a victim immobilized with its tentacles, it inflicts 2 strain and 1 wound at the start of its victims turn. A Dianoga is an aquatic creature and a creature immobilized beneath the surface may well start drowning â€“ see page 214 of the core rules book for more information about suffocation and drowning.

Adversary.Name: Gundark
Adversary.Description: Please see page 432 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.

Ability.Name: Four-Armed
Ability.Description: The Gundark gains [BOOST] on all Brawl checks and may spend [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] on a successful melee attack to hit a second target engaged with it, dealing the same damage as dealt to the original target.

Adversary.Name: Jedi-in-Hiding
Adversary.Description: Please see page 432 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook for details.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Force Rating
Talent.Description: Gain +1 Force Rating.

Talent.Name: Sense Danger
Talent.Description: Once per session, remove [SE][SE] from any 1 check.

Talent.Name: Uncanny Senses
Talent.Description: Add [BO] per rank of Uncanny Senses to all Perception checks.

Talent.Name: Uncanny Reactions
Talent.Description: Add [BO] per rank of Uncanny Reactions to all Vigilance checks.

ForceAbility.Name: Move Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The Force user can move small objects via the power of the Force.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to move one object of silhouette 0 that is within short range up to his maximum range. The default maximum range is short range.

ForceAbility.Name: Enhance Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
When making an Athletics check, the Force user may roll an [B] Enhance power check[b] as part of the pool.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to gain [SU] or [AD] (user's choice) on the check.

ForceAbility.Name: Control: Coordination
ForceAbility.Description: Enhance can be used with the Coordination skill.

ForceAbility.Name: Control: Resilience
ForceAbility.Description: Enhance can be used with the Resilience skill.

ForceAbility.Name: Control: Force Leap (Horizontal)
ForceAbility.Description: Take a Force Leap action: Make an [B]Enhanced power check[b]. The user may spend [FP] to jump horizontally to any location in short range.

ForceAbility.Name: Foresee Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The Force user can feel the Force flowing around everything, seeing what is and what will be.
[P] The user may spend [FP] to gain vague hints of events to come, up to a day into his own, personal future.

ForceAbility.Name: Control: Initiative (Success)
ForceAbility.Description: When making a skill check to determine Initiative, the user may roll a [B] Foresee power check[b] as part of the pool. He may spend [FP] to gain [SU] on the check.

Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Ability.Name: For Quolas!
Ability.Description: As an action, may make a [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Leadership check[b] to add [BO] to all combat checks by allies within short range for one round.

Ability.Name: Glider
Ability.Description: Pathran Helshar can glide over small distances while falling and does not suffer damage from falling while conscious.

Quality.Name: Cumbersome
Quality.Description: Passive: The character needs a Brawn characteristic equal to or greater than the weapon's Cumbersome rating.

Quality.Name: Defensive
Quality.Description: Passive: A character wielding a weapon with the Defensive quality increases his melee defense by the weapons's Defensive rating.

Talent.Name: Crippling Blow
Talent.Description: Increase the difficulty of next combat check by 1. If check deals damage, target suffers 1 strain whenever he moves for the remainder of the encounter.

Ability.Name: Living Shadow
Ability.Description: Add [SE][SE] to all combat checks and Perception checks against phantasmal beasts of Moraband and add [BO][BO] to all Stealth checks the beasts make, in addition to any dice gained for darkness. Applies even to characters not hampered by normal darkness.

Ability.Description: If TH-313 generates [TH][TH][TH] or [DE] on an Athletics, Brawl, or Melee check, he is immobilized for one round.

Quality.Name: Autofire
Quality.Description: Active: Increase the difficulty of the attack by [DIFFICULTY]. If the attack hits the attacker can trigger Auto-fire. Auto-fire can be triggered multiple times.Each time the attacker triggers Auto-fire it deals an additional hit to the target.

Quality.Name: Blast
Quality.Description: Active: If the attack is successful and Blast activates, each character (friend or foe) Engaged with the original target sufferes wounds equal to the weapon's Blast rating.

Quality.Name: Limitedammo
Quality.Description: Passive: May be used to make a number of attacks equal to it's Limited Ammo rating before it must be reloaded.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Center of Being
Talent.Description: Take a Center of Being maneuver. Until the beginning of next turn, attacks against the character increase their critical rating by 1 per rank of Center of Being.

Talent.Name: Center of Being (Improved)
Talent.Description: Suffer 1 strain to perform Center of Being maneuver as an incidental.

Talent.Name: Parry
Talent.Description: When hit by a melee attack, suffer 3 strain to reduce damage by 2 plus ranks in Parry.

Talent.Name: Parry (Improved)
Talent.Description: When parrying a hit that generate [DE] or [TH][TH][TH], may hit attacker once with Lightsaber, Brawl, or Melee weapon (dealing base damage) after original attack resolves.

Talent.Name: Reflect
Talent.Description: When hit by a ranged attack, suffer 3 strain to reduce damage by 2 plus ranks in Reflect.

Talent.Name: Reflect (Improved)
Talent.Description: When reflecting a hit that generated [DE] or [TH][TH][TH] may hit one target in medium range with the same damage as the initial hit, after original attack resolves.

Talent.Name: Saber Throw
Talent.Description: Perform Saber Throw action; make Lightsaber combat check as ranged attack at target within medium range, adding [FO] no greater than Force rating. Must spend [FP] and succeed to hit target; spend [FP] to have weapon return to hand.

Ability.Name: Dark Side Force User
Ability.Description: Uses dark side points instead of light side points.

Ability.Name: [B]Force Power:[b] Enhance
Ability.Description: When making an Athletics, Resilience, or Brawl check, Warde may roll an Enhance power check as part of the pool and spend [FP] to gain [SU] or [AD] on the check. Warde may take the Force Leap maneuver to make an Enhance power check. He may spend [FP] to leap horizontally or vertically to any location in short range. He may spend [FP] to increase the powers range by 1 range band.

Ability.Name: [B]Force Power:[b] Move
Ability.Description: Warde may spend [FP] to move one silhouette 0 object within short range to another location within short range. He may spend [FP] to increase the range of the power to long and may spend [FP] to increase the size of the object he can move to silhouette 2. Ward may hurl an object at a target by making a Move Force power check and rolling a ranged attack (that uses Discipline) as part of the pool. The attack's difficulty is equal to the silhouette of the object being thrown, and only succeeds if Warde can also spend enough [F} to move the object. The attack deals damage equal to the objects silhouette times ten (silhouette 0 objects deal 5 damage), plus one per [SU].

Ability.Name: [B]Force Power:[b] Warde's Foresight
Ability.Description: Warde may spend [FP] to gain hints about what an individual within short range is likely to do in the near future. He may spend [FP] to increase the range of the power to long and may spend [FP][FP] to gain [BO][BO] on his next check against the target. When making a check for initiative, Warde may make a Warde's Foresight power check. He may spend [FP] to add [SU] to his first check this encounter. If he used [DA] for [FP], he may immediately perform one action, but each enemy adds [SU] to the result of his Initiative check.

Ability.Name: Dantari Crystal
Ability.Description: When wielding his lightsaber, may spend [FP] on Force power checks to recover 2 strain.

Ability.Name: Arboreal Creature
Ability.Description: Tarvixes treat trees and branches as normal terrain and do not make checks or spend extra maneuvers in order to move along them vertically or horizontally.

Talent.Description: Add 1 damage per rank of Barrage to 1 hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery skills at long or extreme range.

Talent.Name: Point Blank
Talent.Description: Add 1 damage per rank of Point Blank to damage of one hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at short range or engaged.

Ability.Name: Droid
Ability.Description: Does not need to breathe, eat, or drink and can survive in vacuum or underwater. Immune to poisons or toxins.

Quality.Name: Autofire
Quality.Description: Active: Increase the difficulty of the attack by [DIFFICULTY]. If the attack hits the attacker can trigger Auto-fire. Auto-fire can be triggered multiple times.Each time the attacker triggers Auto-fire it deals an additional hit to the target.

Quality.Name: Cumbersome
Quality.Description: Passive: The character needs a Brawn characteristic equal to or greater than the weapon's Cumbersome rating.

Quality.Description: Passive: Ignores one point of Soak for each rank of Pierce

Quality.Name: Guided

Quality.Name: Limitedammo
Quality.Description: Passive: May be used to make a number of attacks equal to it's Limited Ammo rating before it must be reloaded.

Quality.Name: Prepare
Quality.Description: Passive: The user must perform a number of Prepare maneuvers equal to the weapon's Prepare rating before making attacks.

ForceAbility.Name: Move Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The Force user can move small objects via the power of the Force.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to move one object of silhouette 0 that is within short range up to his maximum range. The default maximum range is short range.

ForceAbility.Name: Sense Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
[P]The Force user can sense the Force interacting with the world around him.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to sense all living things within short range (including sentient and non-sentient beings).
[P]The user may spend [FP] to sense the current emotional state of one living target with whom he is engaged.

ForceAbility.Name: Magnitude
ForceAbility.Description: Spend [FP] to increase targets affected equal to Magnitude upgrades purchased.

ForceAbility.Name: Range
ForceAbility.Description: Spend [FP] to increase power's range by a number of range bands equal to Range upgrades purchased.

ForceAbility.Name: Range
ForceAbility.Description: Spend [FP] to increase power's range by a number of range bands equal to Range upgrades purchased.

ForceAbility.Name: Strength
ForceAbility.Description: When using Sense's ongoing effects, upgrade the pool twice, instead of once.

Ability.Name: On the Edge
Ability.Description: Once per Force check, may suffer 1 strain to use [DARK] result to generate [LIGHT].

Ability.Name: Amphibious
Ability.Description: Dianogas may breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Ability.Name: Crushing Grip
Ability.Description: A dianoga has many tentacles and can maintain a grip on an unfortunate without some while attacking with others. As long as it has a victim immobilized by its tentacles, it inflicts 2 strain and 1 wound at the start of the victim's turn. A dianoga is an aquatic creature and a creature immobilized beneath the surface may well start drowning - see page 214 for more information about suffocation and drowning.

Ability.Name: Energy Parasite
Ability.Description: Mynocks can make an [B]Average ([DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY]) Coordination check[b] to latch onto any starship or vehicle they are engaged with. Ships or vehicles with a mynock attached suffer 1 system strain per mynock each day and reduce their handling by 1.

Ability.Name: Flyer
Ability.Description: Mynocks can fly.

Ability.Name: Helium Allergy
Ability.Description: When exposed to helium, mynocks suffer 1 wound per round ignoring soak, until their bodies inflate and explode.

ForceAbility.Name: Influence Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The character may attempt to guide, shape, and even twist the thoughts and feelings of other.
[P][B]Special Rule ([LI]/[DA] use)[b]: When guiding and shaping thoughts, only [FP] generated from [DA] may be used to generate negative emotions such as rage, fear, and hatred. Only [FP] generated from[LI] may be used to generate positive emotions such as peace, tranquility, and friendliness. Other emotions such as confusion can be created from [FP] generated from either [LI] or [DA].
[P]The character may spend [FP] to stress the mind of one living target he is engaged with, inflicting 1 strain.

ForceAbility.Name: Strength
ForceAbility.Description: When stressing the mind of a target, the character inflicts 2 strain.

When doing so, add [FO] to the check; [FP] generated from [LI] results add [SU] to Charm checks, while [FP] generated from [DA] results add [SU] to Deception checks. If the check succeeds, the illusion is successful, though what effect this has on gameplay depends on the situation and can be determined by the GM. Targets immune to Force powers are immune to these effects.

ForceAbility.Name: Influence Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The character may attempt to guide, shape, and even twist the thoughts and feelings of other.
[P][B]Special Rule ([LI]/[DA] use)[b]: When guiding and shaping thoughts, only [FP] generated from [DA] may be used to generate negative emotions such as rage, fear, and hatred. Only [FP] generated from[LI] may be used to generate positive emotions such as peace, tranquility, and friendliness. Other emotions such as confusion can be created from [FP] generated from either [LI] or [DA].
[P]The character may spend [FP] to stress the mind of one living target he is engaged with, inflicting 1 strain.

ForceAbility.Name: Move Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The Force user can move small objects via the power of the Force.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to move one object of silhouette 0 that is within short range up to his maximum range. The default maximum range is short range.

ForceAbility.Name: Magnitude
ForceAbility.Description: Spend [FP] to increase targets affected equal to Magnitude upgrades purchased.

ForceAbility.Name: Strength

ForceAbility.Name: Range

ForceAbility.Name: Influence Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The character may attempt to guide, shape, and even twist the thoughts and feelings of other.
[P][B]Special Rule ([LI]/[DA] use)[b]: When guiding and shaping thoughts, only [FP] generated from [DA] may be used to generate negative emotions such as rage, fear, and hatred. Only [FP] generated from[LI] may be used to generate positive emotions such as peace, tranquility, and friendliness. Other emotions such as confusion can be created from [FP] generated from either [LI] or [DA].
[P]The character may spend [FP] to stress the mind of one living target he is engaged with, inflicting 1 strain.

ForceAbility.Name: Sense Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
[P]The Force user can sense the Force interacting with the world around him.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to sense all living things within short range (including sentient and non-sentient beings).
[P]The user may spend [FP] to sense the current emotional state of one living target with whom he is engaged.

ForceAbility.Name: Move Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The Force user can move small objects via the power of the Force.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to move one object of silhouette 0 that is within short range up to his maximum range. The default maximum range is short range.

Spend [FP] to deal 2 additional damage (may activate all upgrades multiple times). Spend [FP] to decrease the critical rating of the attack to 1.
