Ability.Description: Can set up a shrieking racket as an action. All enemies within short range must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b]. Failure causes target to suffer 4 strain and beocme disorneited until noise stops. Characters in sealed armor or wearing ear protection are not affected.

Adversary.Name: Fissrit
Adversary.Description: Please see page 75 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Scorching Touch
Ability.Description: When opponent ends its turn engaged with Fissrit, he suffers one wound and 1 strain.

Adversary.Name: Hurghol
Adversary.Description: Please see page 75 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Talent.Name: Beast of Burden
Talent.Description: Add 1 per rank to the mount's encumbrance threshold.

Talent.Name: Domesticable
Talent.Description: Downgrade the difficulty of checks to train this mount by 1 per rank.

Ability.Name: Sure-Footed
Ability.Description: Suffers no penalties when moving through difficult terrain.

Ability.Name: Sustained by the Force
Ability.Description: Hurghols do not need to consume food or water to stay alive.

Adversary.Name: Jerethian Clamberwolf
Adversary.Description: Please see page 75 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Sure-Footed
Ability.Description: Suffers no penalties when moving through difficult terrain.

Adversary.Name: Kath Hound
Adversary.Description: Please see page 76 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Pack Instincts
Ability.Description: When performing the assist maneuver, grant [BOOST][BOOST] instead of [BOOST].

Adversary.Name: Manka Cat
Adversary.Description: Please see page 76 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Pack Instincts
Ability.Description: When performing the assist maneuver, grant [BOOST][BOOST] instead of [BOOST].

Adversary.Name: Mantellian Flutterplume
Adversary.Description: Please see page 76 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Talent.Name: Flyer
Talent.Description: This mount can fly. When on the ground, it's Speed is reduced to 1.

Adversary.Name: Narglatch
Adversary.Description: Please see page 77 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Fierce Pounce
Ability.Description: If the narglatch uses the aim maneuber, it also gains Knockdown on its next attack.

Adversary.Name: Nexu
Adversary.Description: Please see page 77 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Fierce Pounce
Ability.Description: If the nexu uses the aim maneuver, it also gains Knockdown on its next attack.

Adversary.Name: Porvir
Adversary.Description: Please see page 77 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Unthreatening Aura
Ability.Description: When declaring an attack against a porvir within short range, the attacker must suffer 3 strain or choose a different action or target.

Adversary.Name: Reek
Adversary.Description: Please see page 78 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Adversary.Name: Runderen
Adversary.Description: Please see page 78 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Shadowblend
Ability.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of spotting or targeting runderen once when they are in darkness.

Adversary.Name: Spintiri Glowbat
Adversary.Description: Please see page 78 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Talent.Name: Flyer
Talent.Description: This mount can fly. When on the ground, it's Speed is reduced to 1.

Adversary.Name: Uxibeast
Adversary.Description: Please see page 79 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Talent.Name: Beast of Burden
Talent.Description: Add 1 per rank to the mount's encumbrance threshold.

Adversary.Name: Varactyl
Adversary.Description: Please see page 79 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Glider
Ability.Description: Varacytls can suffer 2 strain to count as a flyer for the remainder of the turn. See page 214 of the [I]Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook[i] for details.

Adversary.Name: Vrblther
Adversary.Description: Please see page 79 of the Savage Spirits Sourceboook for details.

Ability.Name: Olfactory Perception
Ability.Description: Gain a [BO] on all Survival checks made to track prey, and adds [SE] to enemy Stealth checks made against the vrblther.

Adversary.Name: "Old" Jho
Adversary.Description: Many years ago the Ithorian now known as "Old" Jho left his homeworld and settled on Lothal. At the time Capital City was predominantly a trading post, but Jho saw a need for support for the many offworld cargo and supply vessels visiting the planet. He found a small settlement that suited his needs and established a cantina and docking bay with repair facilities. The docking bay was large enough to service anything up to the size of a Gozanti transport, but usually hosted smaller vessels. The settlement's original name was forgotten to history and came to be known as Jhothal. [P] Jho is old for an Ithorian, and not as spry as he used to be. He is stubborn though, and will quietly resist any strong arm tactics in his bar, whether they be from Broken Horn thugs or Imperial troops. He keeps a Corellian Arms SKZ Sporting Blaster under the bar should he ever have to resist any hostiles with force, but he knows it's more of a threat than a real option. Jho uses a translation device which enables him to converse in basic with his customers.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Know Somebody
Talent.Description: Once per session, when attempting to purchase a legally available item, reduce its rarity by 1 per rank of Know Somebody.

Talent.Name: Wheel and Deal
Talent.Description: When selling good legally, gain 10% more credits per rank of Wheel and Deal.

Talent.Name: Smooth Talker
Talent.Description: When first acquired choose 1 skill; Charm, Coercion, Deception, or Negotiation. When making checks with that skill spend [TR] to gain additional [SU] equal to ranks in Smooth Talker.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Adversary.Name: Agent Kallus
Adversary.Description: A native of Coruscant, Kallus joined the Imperial Security Bureau soon after the formation of the Empire, and his low operating number (ISB-021 ) is an indication of his rank. A true believer known for his ruthless efficiency, Kallus has made a reputation for himself as being willing to do whatever is necessary to achieve his goal. He is cold and can be cruel, but never without purpose. When he ordered the use of Ion Disruptors against the population of Lasan, it was simply because he viewed it as the most expedient method of getting the job done. He has been key to hunting down and eliminating several fledgling Rebel operations throughout the Outer Rim, and was assigned to Lothal when Rebel activity there caught the attention of the local authorities and they petitioned for specialized assistance.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Armor Master
Talent.Description: When wearing armor, Increase total soak value by 1.

Talent.Name: Command
Talent.Description: Add [BO] per rank of Command when making Leadership checks. Affected targets add [BO] to Discipline checks for next 24 hours.

Talent.Name: Confidence
Talent.Description: May decrease difficulty of Discipline checks to avoid fear by 1 per rank of Confidence.

Talent.Name: Crippling Blow
Talent.Description: Increase the difficulty of next combat check by 1. If check deals damage, target suffers 1 strain whenever he moves for the remainder of the encounter.

Adversary.Name: Baron Valen Rudor
Adversary.Description: Baron Rudor, flight number LS-607, is an expert TIE fighter pilot, who is stationed on Lothal at the request of Sienar Fleet Systems. He has the honor of test flying Sienar's newest generation fighters, and serves as inspiration for the rank and file pilots, although some of the chatter in the flight barracks suggests that his reputation is a result of his noble station rather than actual ability. [P] He has a superior attitude and is condescending to anyone he considers beneath him, which is almost everyone. Although his flight skills have yet to be tested in actual battle, his abilities outside the cockpit are unimpressive at best, as he has been bested in both hand to hand combat and in battles of wits. Fortunately none of his Navy colleagues were witness to these incidents and his reputation therefore remains unimpeached.

Talent.Name: Skilled Jockey
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Skilled Jockey from all Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) checks the character attempts.

Talent.Name: Natural Pilot
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any Piloting (Space) or Gunnery check.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Adversary.Name: Borbig Drob
Adversary.Description: "Presenting Borbig Drob the Houk! Nine-time champion of the Stormblade Bloodfest!" [P]Borbig fights with brute strength and aggressive attacks. Armed with vibro knucklers on both hands, he likes to get up close and personal with his competition and strike with fierce blows. While he can attack with both weapons at once (using the dual wielding rules to increase the difficulty of the attack) , his attack of choice is a sweeping punch with a single fist. He saves the double punch action for when he is desperately behind in the fight or when he thinks it could help him finish his opponent off.

Talent.Name: Lethal Blows
Talent.Description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents.

Quality.Name: Pierce
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignores one point of Soak for each rank of Pierce

Quality.Name: Vicious
Quality.Description: Passive: Add 10 times the Vicious rating to the critical roll.

Mod.Description: Add [SETBACK] to attempts to locate a concealed vibroknuckler.

Adversary.Name: C1-10P "Chopper"
Adversary.Description: If a word had to be used to describe Chopper's personality programming, it would be "grumpy. " This old and battered astromech droid has functioned for years without a memory wipe and while this gives him knowledge and abilities beyond most droids in his class, it has left him with a recalcitrant attitude. [P] Over the years his various systems have been repaired, patched, and replaced with whatever parts could be scrounged or bought cheap. His appearance is a hodgepodge of sometimes illfitting components, which may also be somewhat to blame for his surly outlook. [P] Chopper is however extremely loyal to "his" family, the crew of The Ghost. Whilst he may grumble and complain in his unusual binary chatter, he still gets the job done â€“ often surprisingly effectively. This especially applies to The Ghost, which he and Hera have extensively modified over the years to the extent that other mechanics often feel lost when dealing with its quirks. [P] Chopper has a mischievous streak, often playing pranks on crew members Zeb and Ezra and delighting in the repercussions as they tussle with each other. He is highly intolerant of other droids, and will not hesitate to ruthlessly eliminate any that he views as competition, or even if they just get in his way.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Bad Motivator
Talent.Description: Once per game session, may take a Bad Motivator action; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b] to cause one targeted device to spontaneously fail.

Talent.Name: Bypass Security
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Bypass Security from checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

Talent.Name: Codebreaker
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank in Codebreaker from checks to break codes or decrypt communications. Decrease difficulty of checks to break codes or decrypt communications by 1.

Talent.Name: Gearhead
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Gearhead from Mechanics checks. Have the credit cost to add mods to attachments.

Talent.Name: Natural Tinkerer
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Mechanics check.

Ability.Name: Droid
Ability.Description: Does not need to breathe, eat, or drink and can survive in vacuum or underwater. Immune to poisons or toxins.

Adversary.Name: Cikatro Vizago
Adversary.Description: The founder and head of the Broken Horn crime syndicate, the Devaronian Cikatro Vizago is ruthless and pragmatic. Owing loyalty to no one, he has found a niche market on Lothal and the surrounding systems as a smuggler and information broker. He is loyal to anyone that makes him money and currently the rebels in the Outer Rim offer him more business opportunities than the Empire. However, there is no telling when or if this situation may change. [P] Vizago occasionally receives information unwittingly from Rebel Liaison officers, who use him and other criminal contacts to anonymously filter important intelligence through to their associated Rebel Cells.

Talent.Name: Nobody's Fool
Talent.Description: May upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool.

Talent.Name: Black Market Contacts
Talent.Description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50 percent of base cost per reduction.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Adversary.Name: Cumberlayne Aresko
Adversary.Description: Commandant Cumberlayne Aresko is typical of many Imperial Officers. He is overbearing, overconfident and revels in needless cruelty. He has attained his position through a combination of opportunistic moves rather than any real ability. Although his background is bureaucratic in nature (his posting on Lothal places him in charge of the Imperial Academy) , his position as a ranking officer often means that he is in command of tactical situations. His reliance on by the book procedural doctrine means he is often unable to be an effective leader in the field however, with more experienced field commanders frequently having to follow up his failures.

Talent.Name: Plausible Deniability
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Plausible Deniability from all Coercion and Deception checks.

Ability.Name: Cower
Ability.Description: Gains Ranged Defence 1 while at engaged range with any other allied characters.

Ability.Name: Overwhelming Fire
Ability.Description: May perform a maneuver to direct one Imperial Army minion group within medium range; the group may perform an immediate free combat check action.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Ability.Name: Amphibious
Ability.Description: Dianogas may breath underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Ability.Name: Crushing Grip
Ability.Description: A Dianoga has many tentacles and can maintain a grip on an unfortunate foe with some tentacles, while attacking with others. As long as it has a victim immobilized with its tentacles, it inflicts 2 strain and 1 wound at the start of its victims turn. A Dianoga is an aquatic creature and a creature immobilized beneath the surface may well start drowning â€“ see page 214 of the core rules book for more information about suffocation and drowning.

Adversary.Name: Edgehawk
Adversary.Description: Edgehawks are large predatory avians that inhabit the mountain ranges and cliffs beside the sea. Their traditional prey is the plains-dwelling Loth-Cats, though with the overall reduction in the Loth-cats population due to decreasing farmland, the edgehawks are becoming more desparate and have started encroaching on farmland and coastal settlements, where they scavenge leftovers and on rare occasions have even attacked settlers. Edgehawks have exceptional vision and can see clearly at night, as long as there is moon or starlight.

Ability.Name: Night Vision
Ability.Description: May remove up to [SE][SE] from skill checks due to low light conditions.

Adversary.Name: Ezra Bridger
Adversary.Description: Ezra Bridger is a fifteen year old human male. Eight years ago his parents were detained by the Empire for subversive activities. Since then he has lived alone on the streets of Lothal, using his wits and cunning to survive. He has made a hideout in an abandoned communication tower on the outskirts of Lothal, and this is where he keeps his stash of stolen paraphernalia.

Talent.Name: Force Rating
Talent.Description: Gain +1 Force Rating.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Black Market Contacts
Talent.Description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50 percent of base cost per reduction.

Talent.Name: Forager
Talent.Description: Remove up to [SE][SE] from skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the time.

Talent.Name: Indistinguishable
Talent.Description: Upgrade difficulty of checks to identify character once per rank of Indistinguishable.

ForceAbility.Name: Sense Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
[P]The Force user can sense the Force interacting with the world around him.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to sense all living things within short range (including sentient and non-sentient beings).
[P]The user may spend [FP] to sense the current emotional state of one living target with whom he is engaged.

ForceAbility.Name: Enhance Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
When making an Athletics check, the Force user may roll an [B] Enhance power check[b] as part of the pool.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to gain [SU] or [AD] (user's choice) on the check.

ForceAbility.Name: Control: Force Leap (Vertical)
ForceAbility.Description: When performing a Force Leap, the user can jump vertically in addition to jumping horizontally.

ForceAbility.Name: Control: Force Leap (Horizontal)
ForceAbility.Description: Take a Force Leap action: Make an [B]Enhanced power check[b]. The user may spend [FP] to jump horizontally to any location in short range.

Adversary.Name: Ferpil Wallaway
Adversary.Description: Ferpil will buy almost anything, subject to negotiations, and can supply many items as well. Rumour has it that he has ties to the Broken Horn Syndicate, which allows him to source otherwise unavailable items from off world, although these 'special orders' may take some time to fulfill. He maintains friendly relations with Slyyth, and if customers arrive with a recommendation from the Ruurian, they gain a Boost die [BO] to any Negotiation checks with Ferpil.

Talent.Name: Confidence
Talent.Description: May decrease difficulty of Discipline checks to avoid fear by 1 per rank of Confidence.

Talent.Name: Black Market Contacts
Talent.Description: When purchasing illegal goods, may reduce rarity by 1 per rank of Black Market Contacts, increasing cost by 50 percent of base cost per reduction.

Talent.Name: Nobody's Fool
Talent.Description: May upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Adversary.Name: Fyrnock
Adversary.Description: Fyrnocks, like their distant relatives, the mynocks, are silicon based lifeforms. Fyrnocks are typically found inhabiting caverns or on planetary bodies with little or no direct sunlight. Little is known about societal habits of these creatures, but evidence suggests they are eusocial living in a colony with a single breeding female, the Queen (colloquially Mama Fyrnock) . The bulk of the colony is made up of drones, but a few breeding males (alphas) lead the fight against any interlopers. Fyrnocks are typically very territorial and aggressive, only their severe allergy to most forms of sunlight keeps their population in check.

Ability.Name: Night Stalker
Ability.Description: Opponents ad [SE][SE] to initiative checks if combat begins in areas with poor lighting.

Ability.Name: Leap
Ability.Description: Gains two Boost dice to Athletics checks to perform horizontal or vertical jumps.

Ability.Name: Light Allergy
Ability.Description: Fyrnocks are painfully allergic to natural light. A fyrnock must pass a [B]Difficult ([DI][DI][DI]) fear check[b] to enter light. Any fyrnock exposed to light takes 4 wound damage, ignoring soak.

Ability.Name: Sillicate Lifeform
Ability.Description: Fyrnocks do not register on normal scans for living beings, and even the Force does not always locate them. Add [SE][SE] to any scan or power that attempts to sense life.

Adversary.Name: Fyrnock Alpha
Adversary.Description: Fyrnocks, like their distant relatives, the mynocks, are silicon based lifeforms. Fyrnocks are typically found inhabiting caverns or on planetary bodies with little or no direct sunlight. Little is known about societal habits of these creatures, but evidence suggests they are eusocial living in a colony with a single breeding female, the Queen (colloquially Mama Fyrnock) . The bulk of the colony is made up of drones, but a few breeding males (alphas) lead the fight against any interlopers. Fyrnocks are typically very territorial and aggressive, only their severe allergy to most forms of sunlight keeps their population in check.

Ability.Name: Night Stalker
Ability.Description: Opponents ad [SE][SE] to initiative checks if combat begins in areas with poor lighting.

Ability.Name: Leap
Ability.Description: Gains two Boost dice to Athletics checks to perform horizontal or vertical jumps.

Ability.Name: Light Allergy
Ability.Description: Fyrnocks are painfully allergic to natural light. A fyrnock must pass a [B]Difficult ([DI][DI][DI]) fear check[b] to enter light. Any fyrnock exposed to light takes 4 wound damage, ignoring soak.

Ability.Name: Sillicate Lifeform
Ability.Description: Fyrnocks do not register on normal scans for living beings, and even the Force does not always locate them. Add [SE][SE] to any scan or power that attempts to sense life.

Adversary.Name: Garazeb "Zeb" Orellios
Adversary.Description: Since the destruction of his homeworld Lasan, Zeb has been seeking any avenue possible to strike back at the Empire. A trained Honor Guard on his homeworld, Zeb combines his natural physical prowess with extensive training making him an excellent all round warrior. He is much more cunning and intelligent than his appearance would suggest, a fact he sometimes uses to his advantage against unwitting foes. [P] He is gruff and quick to anger, though towards his crew this bluster is without any real intent. In fact he is fiercely loyal to his friends, and compassionate toward the needy, especially those whose lives have been ruined by the Empire. This compassion does not necessarily extend towards Chopper, whose antics annoy Zeb although he accepts the droid's usefulness. [P] Zeb's zeal to avenge himself on the Empire occasionally bubbles over into recklessness. This was especially apparent when he was confronted by the man who was was largely responsible for the destruction of his world, causing him to lose concentration and lose a critical fight he should have won. [P] Zeb is a master of his signature weapon, the Lasan Honor Guard unique Bo-Rifle. This unusual weapon combines blaster rifle and close-combat electrostaff. Zeb utilizes both these modes, along with his innate strength and agility, to great effect in all forms of combat.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Barrage
Talent.Description: Add 1 damage per rank of Barrage to 1 hit of successful attack while using Ranged (Heavy) or Gunnery skills at long or extreme range.

Talent.Name: Body Guard
Talent.Description: Once per round, perform the Body Guard maneuver to guard an engaged character. Suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Body Guard, then until the beginning of the next turn upgrade the difficulty of combat checks targeting the character by that number.

Talent.Name: Defensive Stance
Talent.Description: Once per round, may perform Defensive Stance maneuver and suffer a number of strain to upgrade difficulty of all incoming melee attacks by an equal number. Strain suffered this way cannot exceed ranks in Defensive Stance.

Talent.Name: Hard Headed
Talent.Description: When staggered or disoriented, perform the Hard Headed action; make a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Discipline check[b] to remove status. Difficulty reduced per rank of Hard Headed.

Ability.Name: Lasat Agility
Ability.Description: Lasat add a [BO] to Athletics checks when climbing or jumping.

Adversary.Name: Hera Syndulla
Adversary.Description: Rebellion is in Hera's blood. Her father, Cham Syndulla, was the inaugural leader of the Free Ryloth movement, which existed shortly after the Empire's rise to power. She is the owner and Captain of the modified VCX-1 00 Freighter named The Ghost, which is both her transport and home. [P] A strong willed and charismatic green-skinned Twi'lek, Hera is the de-facto team leader. She is the only member of the crew entrusted by their Alliance contact, codenamed â€œFulcrumâ€, with the bigger picture. As such, she usually decides on the targets and missions the crew undertakes. [P] Hera has the skills to handle herself in a fight, but her true calling is at the controls of The Ghost, which she can handle so expertly it almost seems to some of her foes that they are up against a starfighter. [P] Hera has often taken on the den-mother role for the Crew, providing advice and protection. However, as strong as her bonds are with every team member, she is pragmatic in times of crisis. Should she need to sacrifice one of them for the overall good of the mission she will do so, but only as an extreme last resort.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Full Throttle
Talent.Description: Take a Full Throttle action; make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Piloting check[b] to increase a vehicle's top speed by 1 for a number of rounds equal to Cunning.

Talent.Name: Skilled Jockey
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Skilled Jockey from all Piloting (Planetary) and Piloting (Space) checks the character attempts.

Talent.Name: Tricky Target
Talent.Description: Count vehicle or starship piloted as having a silhouette 1 lower when being attacked.

Talent.Name: Natural Pilot
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any Piloting (Space) or Gunnery check.

Talent.Name: Defensive Driving
Talent.Description: Increase defense of vehicle or starship being piloted by 1 per rank of Defensive Driving.

Talent.Name: Full Throttle (Improved)
Talent.Description: Suffer 1 strain to attempt Full Throttle as a maneuver and decrease its difficultly to [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b].

Ability.Name: Burn resistance
Ability.Description: Due to Hera's custom flight suit, Hera reduces the damage from fire and weapons with the Burn quality by 1.

Adversary.Name: IG-RM Bodyguard & Enforcer Droid
Adversary.Description: After the Clone Wars, the newly established Empire banned the production of military droids. HoloWan Industries exploited a loophole by listing their IG series as security droids. The IG-RM series are not particularly adaptable, but what they do they do well; and that is identify threats to their master and deal with them quickly and efficiently. They are tough and can handle fairly heavy weaponry with relative ease. They are popular in the retinue of many underworld figures, and the Crime Lord and smuggler Cikatro Vizago uses them exclusively as his personal security force.

Ability.Name: Droid
Ability.Description: Does not need to breathe, eat, or drink and can survive in vacuum or underwater. Immune to poisons or toxins.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Quality.Name: Pierce
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignores one point of Soak for each rank of Pierce

Quality.Name: Vicious
Quality.Description: Passive: Add 10 times the Vicious rating to the critical roll.

Quality.Name: Blast
Quality.Description: Active: If the attack is successful and Blast activates, each character (friend or foe) Engaged with the original target sufferes wounds equal to the weapon's Blast rating.

Quality.Name: Limitedammo
Quality.Description: Passive: May be used to make a number of attacks equal to it's Limited Ammo rating before it must be reloaded.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Ability.Name: Tactical Direction
Ability.Description: May spend a maneuver to direct one Stormtrooper minion group within medium range. The group may perform an immediate free-maneuver or add a [BOOST] to their next check

Quality.Name: Pierce
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignores one point of Soak for each rank of Pierce

Quality.Name: Vicious
Quality.Description: Passive: Add 10 times the Vicious rating to the critical roll.

Quality.Name: Blast
Quality.Description: Active: If the attack is successful and Blast activates, each character (friend or foe) Engaged with the original target sufferes wounds equal to the weapon's Blast rating.

Quality.Name: Limitedammo
Quality.Description: Passive: May be used to make a number of attacks equal to it's Limited Ammo rating before it must be reloaded.

Quality.Name: Autofire
Quality.Description: Active: Increase the difficulty of the attack by [DIFFICULTY]. If the attack hits the attacker can trigger Auto-fire. Auto-fire can be triggered multiple times.Each time the attacker triggers Auto-fire it deals an additional hit to the target.

Quality.Name: Cumbersome
Quality.Description: Passive: The character needs a Brawn characteristic equal to or greater than the weapon's Cumbersome rating.

Adversary.Name: Jinzook Kim
Adversary.Description: Desperate times lead to desperate measures, and for some of the citizens of Lothal, times are desperate. For every citizen looking for a way to improve their situation, there's a seedy character looking to take advantage of them. Jinzook Kim has established himself as a loan shark with a reputation for being very sympathetic to people who need money. [P] When the human first appeared in the seedy side streets of Capital City, the citizens thought he was a generous and kind person looking to help his fellow citizens. However, when some of his initial customers were unable to repay their loan, he showed a different side. Beaten and bloodied clients of his soon found themselves doing anything and everything to regain the money they owed him. In recent months, he's hired some muscle to do the dirty work for him and help him collect any delinquent payments by any means necessary. There are also some rumblings that he may now have the backing of a more prominent crime lord, but any external ties have been kept quiet for now.

Talent.Name: Convincing Demeanor
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Convincing Demeanor from any Deception or Skulduggery checks.

Talent.Name: Smooth Talker
Talent.Description: When first acquired choose 1 skill; Charm, Coercion, Deception, or Negotiation. When making checks with that skill spend [TR] to gain additional [SU] equal to ranks in Smooth Talker.

Talent.Name: Natural Charmer
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll 1 Charm or Deception check.

Talent.Name: Nobody's Fool
Talent.Description: May upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool.

Adversary.Name: Josteckk
Adversary.Description: â€œOur next fighter started his career as an enslaved gladiator fighting in the slave pits. That is, until he murdered his owner and set himself free! Now he fights only for himself, and he enjoys every minute of it. Letâ€™s get a big Wookiee roar for Josteckk!â€ [P] While the bowcaster is often recognized as a traditional Wookiee weapon, the Ryyk Blade is its lesser known melee complement. Forged with fine craftsmanship, its deadly combination of weight, balance, and razor sharpness make it an incredibly dangerous weapon when in capable hands. And Josteckk has very capable hands. He has been fighting in tournaments like this for years, and understands when to attack and when to patiently wait for the right opening. However once he starts taking damage himself, the instinct kicks in and his Wookiee Rage ability leads to a more aggressive and dangerous approach.

Talent.Name: Durable
Talent.Description: May reduce any Critical Injury suffered by 10 per rank of Durable to a minimum of 1.

Ability.Name: Wookiee Rage
Ability.Description: When the Wookiee Gladiator suffers any wounds, he deals +1 damage with Brawl and Melee attacks. When suffering a Critical Injury, he deals +2 damage with Brawl and Melee attacks instead.

Quality.Name: Cumbersome
Quality.Description: Passive: The character needs a Brawn characteristic equal to or greater than the weapon's Cumbersome rating.

Quality.Name: Defensive
Quality.Description: Passive: A character wielding a weapon with the Defensive quality increases his melee defense by the weapons's Defensive rating.

Quality.Name: Superior
Quality.Description: Passive: Generates automatic [ADVANTAGE] on all checks

Adversary.Name: K'elana
Adversary.Description: â€œOur next combatant certainly knows how to make a point, and that point it usually a fatal one as her spear pierces the throat of her opponent! Making her Gladiator Night debut after killing her husband in order to take his chance at glory, the Weequay Widow is ready to make a name for herself and put herself among the most dangerous women in the galaxy! Give it up for Kâ€™elana!â€ [P] The Weequay relies on speed and agility to circle around slower opponents and jab at them with her armor piercing vibro spear. While she does rely on her dexterity, she also does not want to be viewed as being afraid or fighting too defensively, so she remains aggressive and stays within striking range at all times.

Talent.Name: Dodge
Talent.Description: When targeted by combat check, may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number.

Talent.Name: Resolve
Talent.Description: When a character involuntarily suffers strain, he suffers 1 less strain per tank of Resolve to a minimum of 1.

Quality.Name: Pierce
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignores one point of Soak for each rank of Pierce

Quality.Name: Vicious
Quality.Description: Passive: Add 10 times the Vicious rating to the critical roll.

Adversary.Name: Kanan Jarrus
Adversary.Description: The Clone Wars came to a devastating end for the Jedi with with the realization of Senator Palpatine's (secretly the Sith Lord Darth Sidious) master plan â€“ Order 66. This program was a hardwired command in the brains of the Clone Troopers which made them believe the Jedi were a traitorous enemy who had to be immediately eliminated. Very few of the Jedi escaped this betrayal. The padawan Caleb Dume was one of them. [P] Without his master Depa Billaba, young Caleb was left alone and terrified in a Galaxy suddenly turned hostile to his kind. The Jedi Order had taught him skills in combat and the Force, and a multitude of philosophical and diplomatic techniques. But without the comfort and support of the Jedi temple and the Order, Caleb had to adapt very quickly and learn how to survive. [P] He changed his name to Kanan Jarrus, disassembled his lightsaber so its true nature would not be immediately obvious, and stopped drawing on the Force. Instead of championing the needy, he became a drifter, moving from one menial job to the next, keeping a low profile, and often ending the day in some seedy spaceport cantina. Although he tried to avoid attention and conflict, he would defend himself with fists or a blaster pistol when he needed to. [P] After he met Hera and joined her cause, he remembered something of what he had once been. Although still keeping his Jedi heritage a secret, he relished the chance to help the needy by disrupting Imperial operations. What he could never have guessed was how his life would dramatically change once more upon meeting a young street thief named Ezra.

Talent.Name: Force Rating
Talent.Description: Gain +1 Force Rating.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

ForceAbility.Name: Sense Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
[P]The Force user can sense the Force interacting with the world around him.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to sense all living things within short range (including sentient and non-sentient beings).
[P]The user may spend [FP] to sense the current emotional state of one living target with whom he is engaged.

ForceAbility.Name: Move Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The Force user can move small objects via the power of the Force.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to move one object of silhouette 0 that is within short range up to his maximum range. The default maximum range is short range.

ForceAbility.Name: Enhance Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
When making an Athletics check, the Force user may roll an [B] Enhance power check[b] as part of the pool.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to gain [SU] or [AD] (user's choice) on the check.

ForceAbility.Name: Influence Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The character may attempt to guide, shape, and even twist the thoughts and feelings of other.
[P][B]Special Rule ([LI]/[DA] use)[b]: When guiding and shaping thoughts, only [FP] generated from [DA] may be used to generate negative emotions such as rage, fear, and hatred. Only [FP] generated from[LI] may be used to generate positive emotions such as peace, tranquility, and friendliness. Other emotions such as confusion can be created from [FP] generated from either [LI] or [DA].
[P]The character may spend [FP] to stress the mind of one living target he is engaged with, inflicting 1 strain.

ForceAbility.Name: Strength
ForceAbility.Description: Spend [FP] to increase silhouette able to be targeted equal to Strength upgrades purchased.

ForceAbility.Name: Control: Brawl
ForceAbility.Description: Enhance can be used with the Brawl skill.

ForceAbility.Name: Duration
ForceAbility.Description: Spend [FP] to increase duration by number of rounds (or minutes) equal to Duration upgrades purchased.

ForceAbility.Name: Control: Emotion/Belief
ForceAbility.Description: The Force user may make an [B]opposed Discipline vs. Discipline check[b] combined with an [B]Influence power check[b]. If the user spends [FP] and succeeds on the check, he can force the target to adopt an emotional state or believe something untrue, lasting for 1 round or 5 minutes.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Quality.Name: Breach
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignore one point of Armor for every rank of Breach

Quality.Name: Sunder
Quality.Description: Active: Damages opposing weapon one step.

Adversary.Name: Kraykatta
Adversary.Description: Kraykatta is a somewhat unusual wookiee. Heâ€™s fairly laid back and doesnâ€™t take things very seriously, and he also likes to drink. A lot. The two things he does take seriously are his prowess as a tracker and his ability to outdrink any living creature. When asked about being a guide or if he knows of the obelisk, he says that he will only provide his unparalleled guide services to those who have proven to be worthy - by facing him in a drinking contest!

Talent.Name: Familiar Suns
Talent.Description: Once per session, may perform a Familiar Suns maneuver; make a [B] Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Knowledge (Outer Rim)[b] or [B](Core Worlds) check[b] to reveal the current type of planetary environment and other useful information.

Talent.Name: Forager
Talent.Description: Remove up to [SE][SE] from skill checks to find food, water, or shelter. Survival checks to forage take half the time.

Talent.Name: Natural Outdoorsman
Talent.Description: Once per session, may reroll any 1 Resilience or Survival check.

Talent.Name: Outdoorsman
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Outdoorsman from checks to move through terrain or manage environmental effects. Decrease overland travel times by half.

Ability.Name: Wookiee Rage
Ability.Description: When the Wookiee Gladiator suffers any wounds, he deals +1 damage with Brawl and Melee attacks. When suffering a Critical Injury, he deals +2 damage with Brawl and Melee attacks instead.

Quality.Name: Cumbersome
Quality.Description: Passive: The character needs a Brawn characteristic equal to or greater than the weapon's Cumbersome rating.

Quality.Name: Knockdown
Quality.Description: Active: The target is knocked prone.

Quality.Name: Knockdown
Quality.Description: Active: The target is knocked prone.

Quality.Name: Limitedammo
Quality.Description: Passive: May be used to make a number of attacks equal to it's Limited Ammo rating before it must be reloaded.

Quality.Name: Ensnare
Quality.Description: Active: The target is immobilized for a number of rounds equal to the weapon's Ensnare rating.

Quality.Name: Pierce
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignores one point of Soak for each rank of Pierce

Quality.Name: Vicious
Quality.Description: Passive: Add 10 times the Vicious rating to the critical roll.

BaseMods.Description: Has soak value of 2 against all energy-based weapons

Adversary.Name: Lasowd
Adversary.Description: The Trandoshan circles his opponent like a predator circling its prey, waiting for the prey to blink so he can pounce with his Vibro-ax and slice it open. Lasowd is constantly making a hissing noise during his fights, something that some opponents find intimidating, while others simply find it annoying.â€œThis Trandoshan hunter has racked up an impressive number of kills throughout the most dangerous parts of the galaxy. Heâ€™s looking to add some more notches to his belt and please the Scorekeeper, and maybe even add a new Wookiee pelt to his collection. Introducing Lasowd!â€ [P]

Ability.Name: Regeneration
Ability.Description: Recover 1 additional wound from natural rest or bacta tank, regrow lost limb in 1 month.

Quality.Name: Pierce
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignores one point of Soak for each rank of Pierce

Quality.Name: Sunder
Quality.Description: Active: Damages opposing weapon one step.

Quality.Name: Vicious
Quality.Description: Passive: Add 10 times the Vicious rating to the critical roll.

Adversary.Name: Loth-cat
Adversary.Description: Loth-cats are small feline mammals. Although a variety of the common Tooka found on many worlds, the Loth-cat has distinctive decoration and behaviours that are unique to the Lothal variant. The present day Loth-cats are almost exclusively feral but in the past many were domesticated as pets.

Ability.Name: Territorial
Ability.Description: Gain boost to all Brawl checks when defending what it considers to be it's own territory.

Ability.Name: Leap
Ability.Description: Gains two Boost dice to Athletics checks to perform horizontal or vertical jumps.

Adversary.Name: Loth-Rat
Adversary.Description:
Loth-rats are grey coloured scaled rodent-like creatures, with bright red eyes. Despite being called rats, they are actually reptillian. They average about 30 cm in length when fully grown.
Loth-rats are found all over the planet, from the Grasslands (where they are hunted by the Tookas, or Loth-Cats) to the sewer and maintenance tunnels beneath Capital City. They are cowardly by nature, and will generally only attack in packs of ten or more, preferring to target other small animals. They will often flee the noise and smell of humanoid beings, although not always, depending on their hunger or desperation.

Ability.Name: Survival Instincts
Ability.Description: If the minion group takes 50% casualties, it must make an average Willpower check. Failure means the group scatters and flees.

Ability.Name: Swarm Tactics
Ability.Description: Loth-rats generally attack by swarming over a target and biting and clawing it until it is dead. This combined with their relatively small size makes them very tricky to fight in melee combat, granting them a melee defence of 2.

Adversary.Name: Loth-Wolf
Adversary.Description: Loth-Wolves much like the Loth-cats, are a localised variant of a common galactic species, in this case the Anooba. These large aggressive canines are carnivorous and ferocious, often willing to attack a larger target. Although they can be domesticated, and make excellent guard animals, the time and risks involved are substantial. Loth-wolves mate for life, and hunt in pairs, using flanking tactics to distract a target while their partner closes in.

Talent.Name: Tricky Target
Talent.Description: Count vehicle or starship piloted as having a silhouette 1 lower when being attacked.

Ability.Name: Tricky Target
Ability.Description: The Loth-wolf is very agile, dodging and weaving as it closes for the kill. Once per round, the Loth-wolf may use it's Co-Ordination as the opposing difficulty for a ranged attack. It may not do this while engaged with a target.

Adversary.Name: Mama Fyrnock
Adversary.Description: Fyrnocks, like their distant relatives, the mynocks, are silicon based lifeforms. Fyrnocks are typically found inhabiting caverns or on planetary bodies with little or no direct sunlight. Little is known about societal habits of these creatures, but evidence suggests they are eusocial living in a colony with a single breeding female, the Queen (colloquially Mama Fyrnock) . The bulk of the colony is made up of drones, but a few breeding males (alphas) lead the fight against any interlopers. Fyrnocks are typically very territorial and aggressive, only their severe allergy to most forms of sunlight keeps their population in check.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Ability.Name: Silhouette
Ability.Description: Mama Fyrnock has a silhouette of 2, reducing the difficulty to attack her by one.

Ability.Name: Queen of Darkness
Ability.Description: All fyrnocks gain a [BO] to Brawl checks and are immune to Fear when within sight of Mama Fyrnock.

Ability.Name: Night Stalker
Ability.Description: Opponents ad [SE][SE] to initiative checks if combat begins in areas with poor lighting.

Ability.Name: Leap
Ability.Description: Gains two Boost dice to Athletics checks to perform horizontal or vertical jumps.

Ability.Name: Light Allergy
Ability.Description: Fyrnocks are painfully allergic to natural light. A fyrnock must pass a [B]Difficult ([DI][DI][DI]) fear check[b] to enter light. Any fyrnock exposed to light takes 4 wound damage, ignoring soak.

Ability.Name: Sillicate Lifeform
Ability.Description: Fyrnocks do not register on normal scans for living beings, and even the Force does not always locate them. Add [SE][SE] to any scan or power that attempts to sense life.

Adversary.Name: Minister Maketh Tua
Adversary.Description: A native of Lothal and a graduate of the Imperial Academy, Minister Tua considers herself to have more in common with the more cultured Core worlds than her home. During her training she travelled extensively in the Core systems, including Coruscant and Corulag, which she related to much more than her â€œbarely civilizedâ€ Outer Rim home. [P] Although she can appear cold, she does not use her position to enrich herself, believing that service to the Empire is its own reward. [P] She is responsible for the efficient running of Lothal's Industries during Governor Pryce's extensive off world excursions. She also brought in the Galactic Farm Exchange and Imperial Registration programmes, believing that they were in the best interests of the citizens of Lothal. She is intelligent, but can be somewhat naive.

Talent.Name: Confidence
Talent.Description: May decrease difficulty of Discipline checks to avoid fear by 1 per rank of Confidence.

Talent.Name: Nobody's Fool
Talent.Description: May upgrade difficulty of incoming Charm, Coercion, or Deception checks once per rank of Nobody's Fool.

Adversary.Name: Morko
Adversary.Description: â€œHe once worked as a guard for a Hutt but was fired for being a little too rough with the guests. Now he looks to get rough with the other gladiators. Donâ€™t let the big belly fool you, this Gamorrean is in shape and ready to rumble. Introducing Morko!â€ [P] Morko carries the traditional Gamorrean axe, a heavy and vicious weapon that has been known to sever limbs with a single strike. Morko does not know the meaning of defense, agility, or retreat. He can barely even move fast enough for it to be considered running. What he does do is lumber forward with incredible brute strength and swing the mighty axe with bad intentions.

Talent.Name: Knockdown
Talent.Description: After hitting with a melee attack, may spend [TR] to knock the target prone.

Quality.Name: Cumbersome
Quality.Description: Passive: The character needs a Brawn characteristic equal to or greater than the weapon's Cumbersome rating.

Quality.Name: Inferior
Quality.Description: Passive: Generates automatic [THREAT] on all checks.

Quality.Name: Pierce
Quality.Description: Passive: Ignores one point of Soak for each rank of Pierce

Quality.Name: Sunder
Quality.Description: Active: Damages opposing weapon one step.

Adversary.Name: Myles Grint
Adversary.Description: There are many ways to excel within the ranks of the Empire: personal ability, achievement, intelligence. Taskmaster Grint chose none of these. Early in his career he found himself in the orbit of an ambitious, sneaky young officer named Cumberlayne Aresko. They complemented each other perfectly â€“ one providing the ambition and cunning, the other providing the muscle and protection. A large muscular man, Grint is less intelligent and more bullying than most officers, revelling in his position to command others, to get what he wants and generally make the lives of others a misery. Along with Commandant Aresko, he is co-commander of the Imperial Academy on Lothal, and is often involved in military operations. Despite his less than stellar effectiveness, he has been protected so far by his position and his relationship with Aresko. effectiveness, he has been protected so far by his position and his relationship with Aresko.

Talent.Name: Burly
Talent.Description: Reduce any weilded weapon's Cumbersome quality and Encumberance rating by a nyumber equal to ranks in Burly to a minimum of 1.

Talent.Name: Commanding Presence
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Commanding Presence from Leadership and Cool checks.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Adversary.Name: Rugor the Red
Adversary.Description: â€œThis crafty Twiâ€™lekâ€™s trademark whip has left many opponents face down in the dirt as he finishes them off with a debilitating shock to the head! Rugor the Red did not get that name for his red skin, but for the amount of blood he has spilled! Letâ€™s hear it for Rugor!â€ [P] With a shock prod in one hand and a whip in the other, Rugor the Red likes to circle around his opponents looking for a chance to trip them up and move in and out before they can counterattack. This means he is quite willing to move in, attack, and move back out (suffering two Strain for the extra maneuver) . This tactic can be effective, but he can only sustain it for so long before approaching his Strain threshold. While his reluctance to engage directly and stand toe to toe can be frustrating to his opponents â€“ and fans who want to see action â€“ it can be quite effective and the crowd quickly changes its boos to cheers as he moves in for the kill against a snared opponent.

Talent.Name: Dodge
Talent.Description: When targeted by combat check, may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number.

Quality.Name: Concussive
Quality.Description: Active: The target is staggered for a number of rounds equal to the weapon's Concussive rating.

Quality.Name: Stundamage
Quality.Description: Passive: Weapon deals damage as strain instead of wounds.

Quality.Name: Ensnare
Quality.Description: Active: The target is immobilized for a number of rounds equal to the weapon's Ensnare rating.

Quality.Name: Stundamage
Quality.Description: Passive: Weapon deals damage as strain instead of wounds.

Adversary.Name: Sabine Wren
Adversary.Description: Sabine is tactically astute and well versed in Imperial procedures. She is a deadly shot with her twin Westar-35 blaster pistols, and an explosives expert. She will often rig her sabotage targets in such a way that the subsequent explosion is aesthetically pleasing as well as efficient. Sabine is an artist, and beyond explosions she has personalized her gear and quarters. She is also responsible for the iconic â€œstarbirdâ€ motif that the rebels leave behind as a calling card.After the Clone Wars, the planet Mandalore was in chaos. A violent Civil War and subsequent Republic intervention had torn the planet apart. When the Republic transitioned into the Galactic Empire, they set up an Imperial Academy on Mandalore. Many young Mandalorians, disillusioned with the strife they had seen, welcomed the stability of the Empire and signed up. Sabine Wren was one of these. [P] She was initially a model student. Excelling in combat training, language studies, and tactical co-ordination, she was likely on the fast track to a promising career of Imperial Service. She has spoken little of what happened to change all that, simply alluding to the fact that blindly following orders led to â€œa nightmareâ€. This may have involved her family, whom she claims to have lost to the Empire. Realizing what the Empire was really capable of, she left Mandalore and at some point met up with Hera. This distrust for authority has manifested in her dealings with Hera, who for reasons of operational protocol has to withhold certain information from the rest of the crew. [P]

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Dodge
Talent.Description: When targeted by combat check, may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number.

Talent.Name: Distracting Behavior
Talent.Description: Make a Distracting Behavior maneuver and suffer strain no greater than ranks in Cunning. Until the beginning of next turn, equal number of NPC's suffer [TH] on checks. Range increases with additional ranks.

Talent.Name: Armor Master
Talent.Description: When wearing armor, Increase total soak value by 1.

Adversary.Name: Slyyth
Adversary.Description: Although the inhabitants of Loth-Rat Alley come and go seemingly at random, one in particular can usually be found lurking in one of its shady corners, grooming the next generation of street urchins and thieves. This is Slyyth, a Ruurian pickpocket. He maintains a stable of orphaned street younglings whom he trains to survive in the alleys and backstreets of Capital City. In return he keeps 90% of their take. It is beneficial to maintain good relations with Slyyth (a successful Charm check) as he knows many of the players in the Lothal underworld.

Talent.Name: Bypass Security
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Bypass Security from checks made to disable a security device or open a locked door.

Talent.Name: Street Smarts
Talent.Description: Remove [SE] per rank of Street Smarts from Streetwise or Knowledge (Underworld) checks.

Adversary.Name: The Inquisitor
Adversary.Description: The Empire's ruthless Jedi hunter, as with all dark side adepts, is a unique adversary and an intriguing agent of The Inquisition. As a Pau'an aligned with the New Order, it could be assumed he is a former CIS (Confederacy of Independent Systems) loyalist or an acolyte recruited through the Separatist Crisis. It is known that the Dark Lord Sidious kidnapped several Force Sensitive children with the aid of the bounty hunter Cad Bane. Although that attempt was foiled by the Jedi, The Inquisitor may be the product of a later iteration of that plan. [P] Combining the dualist maneuvers of Makashi, the aggressiveness and acrobatics of Ataru, and the extensive use of the Move Force power, it is clear that as a master of lightsaber combat, The Inquisitor uses the fifth form, also known as Niman. However, as a dark side adept, he also uses many of the Sith tools, seeding fear and doubt into his rivals. He is also not without the usual tools of the inquisition; torture, piloting, and leadership with a devilish conviction. [P] Although his title â€œThe Inquisitorâ€ suggests that his is a singular office, it is assumed that other Imperial Inquisitors do exist. [P] The Inquisitor holds a unique position within the Imperial command hierarchy. He generally has the authority to assume command of any and all forces on a given world, with only an Imperial Governor or Moff able to command him. He reports directly to Lord Darth Vader, who may place him under the temporary command of any other officer as the specific situation demands.

Talent.Name: Adversary
Talent.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of any combat check targeting this character once per rank of Adversary.

Talent.Name: Scathing Tirade
Talent.Description: Take a Scathing Tirade action; make an [B] Average ([DI][DI]) Coercion check[b]. Each [SU] causes one enemy in short range to suffer 1 strain. Spend [AD] to cause 1 affected enemy to suffer 1 additional strain.

Talent.Name: Scathing Tirade (Improved)
Talent.Description: Each enemy affected by Scathing Tirade suffers [SE] on all skill checks for a number of rounds equal to ranks in Coercion.

Talent.Name: Force Rating
Talent.Description: Gain +1 Force Rating.

ForceAbility.Name: Move Basic Power
ForceAbility.Description:
The Force user can move small objects via the power of the Force.
[P]The user may spend [FP] to move one object of silhouette 0 that is within short range up to his maximum range. The default maximum range is short range.

Ability.Name: Drive Back
Ability.Description: The Inquisitor may spend [TR] or [AD][AD][AD] on a missed Brawl, Melee, or Lightsaber combat check to force his target to make a move maneuver in the direction of the Inquisitors choice.

Ability.Name: Aura of Command
Ability.Description: The Inquisitor may spend a maneuver to allow one allied minion group at medium range to immediately perform one maneuver or action. Add [BO] to any actions they perform.

Ability.Name: Lightsaber Mastery
Ability.Description: When making a check using the Lightsaber skill the Inquisitor may use the chosen characteristic (Agility) instead of Brawn

Ability.Name: Terrifying
Ability.Description: At the beginning of an encounter each of The Inquisitor's enemies must make a [B]Hard ([DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY]) Fear check[b] .

Adversary.Name: Tibidee
Adversary.Description:
The Tibidee is a large flying creature found in the mountainous ranges of several Outer Rim worlds, including Stygeon Prime. Although their planet of origin is yet to be determined, they are able to survive for extended periods in space, possibly migrating to different worlds attached to hulls of merchant vessels in the manner of their distant relations such as neebrays and mynocks.
Tibidees are sensitive to electromagnetic wavelengths, and inventive beast riders have created several varieties of transmitters in order to guide or control the Tibidees. These devices can be used to encourage the tibidee to follow specific signals, or even attack nearby enemies.
Any standard Datapad and Comlink can be tuned to transmit tibidee control frequencies with a Hard Computers check. Such a device grants the tibidee the Trained Mount 1 ability. A successful Average Xenology check can reduce the difficulty of the Computers check to Easy .

Ability.Name: Flyer
Ability.Description: This creature can fly. See Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook p202 , or Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook page 214.

Adversary.Name: W'jilee
Adversary.Description: â€œIntroducing Wâ€™jilee the Whipid, a ferocious competitor who once served as bodyguard to the the prince of Naboo!â€ [P] Wâ€™jilee (pronounced â€œWillieâ€) wields a Gaffi stick like an extension of his arms. Displaying surprising coordination for a creature of his size, he manages to move with speed and power. The weapon also provides some defensive cover that can be used to block incoming attacks, and he sometimes uses that to his advantage. While his size and quickness is often an advantage in combat, he is not as overly aggressive as some might expect.

Talent.Name: Lethal Blows
Talent.Description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents.

Quality.Name: Defensive
Quality.Description: Passive: A character wielding a weapon with the Defensive quality increases his melee defense by the weapons's Defensive rating.

Quality.Name: Disorient
Quality.Description: Active: The target is disoriented for a number of rounds equal to the weapon's Disorient rating.

Adversary.Name: Warjak
Adversary.Description: "Warjak the Feeorin! Undefeated champion of the Outer Rim Carve-up!" [P] The male Feeorin is quick with the sword and nimble enough to dodge attacks from less agile opponents. The vibrosword is his weapon of choice, and while it does not appear to be the most heavy and dangerous weapon, its ability to pierce through armor makes it more deadly than it may appear at first glance. Against bigger and stronger opponents, he will not hesitate to take extra maneuvers in order to stay out of range of the more damaging blows. Defense and avoiding attacks is a big part of his strategy.

Talent.Name: Dodge
Talent.Description: When targeted by combat check, may perform a Dodge incidental to suffer a number of strain no greater than ranks of Dodge, then upgrade the difficulty of the check by that number.

Talent.Name: Lethal Blows
Talent.Description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents.

Quality.Name: Defensive
Quality.Description: Passive: A character wielding a weapon with the Defensive quality increases his melee defense by the weapons's Defensive rating.

Quality.Name: Pierce

Adversary.Name: Yen and Werry
Adversary.Description: Yen is a Mon Calamari, Werry is a Quarren. For game purposes they have the same stats. [P] Yen & Werry have lots of friends amongst the fishing crews as well, ensuring they get first pick of the day's catch. [P] The Port & Star-board Diner is a favourite haunt of Imperial Academy students, as well as some instructors and occasionally even Officers. Yen & Werry operate a â€œstow the politics at the doorâ€ policy and all are welcome. This non-partisan air of hospitality is actually something of a front however, and the crafty cooks have very perceptive, if non-obvious, ears. [P] They are no friends to the Empire, having fled their homeworld several years prior due to Imperial incursion, only to see a similar fate befall Lothal. All Imperial personnel get their first drink free, and street rumours that these are spiked are completely unproven. If you are looking for the latest inside Imperial gossip, you may be surprised at the tales Yen and Werry can tell.

Talent.Name: Black Market Contacts

Ability.Name: Imperial Confidant
Ability.Description: Yen & Werry may add a boost die to any Knowledge (Warfare) checks relating to Imperial operations on Lothal.

Ability.Description: Anyone hearing the howl of a wrix must make a [B]Hard ([DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY]) Discipline check[b] or become disoriented for 1 round plus 1 additional round for every [THREAT] generated. [DESPAIR] may be spent to stagger target for 1 round.

Adversary.Name: Coruscant Underworld Police
Adversary.Description: Anonymous and imposing in their long leather uniforms and enclosing helmets, the Underworld Police are a mystery to most. However, few who have been on the wrong end of their heavy blasters doubt the danger they pose for lawbreakers.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting
Quality.Description: Passive: Can switch weapon to Stun Damage

Ability.Name: Duracrete Plating
Ability.Description: Melee and ranged attacks targetting the slug gain a [SETBACK] due to its armored carapace. Characters may aim to hit weak spots and ignore 1 soak.

Talent.Name: Lethal Blows
Talent.Description: Add +10 per rank of Lethal Blows to any Critical Injury results inflicted on opponents.

Talent.Name: Resolve
Talent.Description: When a character involuntarily suffers strain, he suffers 1 less strain per tank of Resolve to a minimum of 1.

Ability.Name: Enhanced Nemesis Combat
Ability.Description: GM should add an additional NPC Initiative slot at the end of the Initiative order. The nemesis may take a second turn during the same round in this slot. Any effects that are supposed to end during his next turn end instead during his next turn in the following round.

Quality.Name: Stunsetting

Talent.Name: Knockdown
Talent.Description: After hitting with a melee attack, may spend [TR] to knock the target prone.

Ability.Name: Poisoning
Ability.Description: Spend [ADVANTAGE][ADVANTAGE] to inflict poison with claws. Target must succeed at an [B]Average ([DIFFICULTY][DIFFICULTY]) Resilience check[b] or suffer 5 strain and lose his free maneuver for a number of rounds equal to the number of [THRAT] generated during the Resilience check.

Adversary.Name: Police Droid
Adversary.Description: In lieu of wasting precious policemen on routine patrols and minor transgressions, the Coruscant Underworld Police frequently employ droids to help keep the peace.
